author: jcej
msg: It turns out that if you use -d and -p together, the argument to -p
must include the path to the project file.

author: jcej
msg: I think this is more accurate. I was setting the buildfile when I
should have been setting the projectfile instead. Oddly enough, it
actually worked that way... I would like to get a meaningful error
when it can't find the project file but I can't figure the best way
to do it so I'll take a look at it again tomorrow.
